modules.get_data_claims package¶

Submodules¶

modules.get_data_claims.ClaimsTranslate module¶

class modules.get_data_claims.ClaimsTranslate.IsolateDataClaim[source]¶

Bases: object

This class has as main function isolate the variable or structure related in the properties that has been identified by ESC/JAVA, and then it applies the respective translation to each type of property.

check_translated_is_empty(_string)[source]¶

This is a simple checking where is identified if it was possible to translate the property, in negative case the text of the translated property is a empty string.

Parameters:_string – the text of the translated property
Type:_string: str
Returns:True if is empty and False otherwise.
generateScopeByLineNumber(_javafile)[source]¶

Generate the data about the scope of the java program analyzed, i.e., it is identified where the class and method start and finish based on the its line numbers.

Parameters:_javafile (str) – the path of the C program file
Return void:the method set in the atributes of the class to values related to number line of begin and end of the functions in the analyzed program
getObjectInClaim(lineNumber, tagComm, claim, _commentCl, indexPointed, annoted)[source]¶

Method to gather the object pointed in the property, and then apply the translation rule according to its TAG property.

Parameters:
  • lineNumber (str) – the line number where it was identified the property
  • tagComm (str) – the identifier of the property identified, e.g., IndexTooBig to possible upper bound violation
  • claim (str) – the assertion/property definied by ESC/JAVA
  • _commentCl (str) – the comments about the property identified
  • indexPointed – the index of the object that is related to the property violation in the assertion
  • annoted – extra comments, in most cases related to code annotation.
Returns:

the text of the property translated (self.claim_translated) in the JFORTES format
getObjectPointed()[source]¶

This method is related to get the object pointed by identifier (^) in the property, and then translate the property to JFORTES format.

Returns:The list with all properties translated in self.claim_list_translated
getOnlyVarName(var)[source]¶

Gather only the name of the variable that has been analyzed.

Parameters:var (str) – a text with the variable that has been analyzed.
Returns:the name of the variable in matchVar.group(1)
getTagsFromComments()[source]¶

Gather the TAG property (a identifier) from the comments. This tag will help to apply the rules to get the objects pointed in the claim and also to apply the transformation rule.

getValueFromReturn(indexList)[source]¶

Gather the value point out in the funtion return

Parameters:indexList (int) – the index of the the current method analyzed from the Java program
Returns:the value of the return in matchReturn.group(1)
loadDataFromCsv(csvFileClaims, javaFile)[source]¶

Load data from csv file spliting the data by delimiter ‘;’. Additionally the method create a dictionary where the keys are the name columns of the csv file.

Parameters:
  • csvFileClaims (str) – CSV file path
  • javaFile (str) – Java file path
Returns:

Assign the values to dictionary self.columns_csv
reset_var_claims()[source]¶

This method just reset the values of the following atributes

setData2Lists()[source]¶

This method based on the values extracted from csv file in the method loadDataFromCsv(self, csvFileClaims, javaFile) creates for each column a list that are attributes of this class.

set_debug_flag()[source]¶

Define True to flag self.DEBUG_STATUS to debugging the code.

set_testing_flag()[source]¶

Define True to flag self.TESTING_STATUS to enable option to monitor the testing execution.

whatIsTheScope(lineNum)[source]¶

Identify the scope based where the analyzed line number is located in the Java program. It is worth noting that we adopt IDs based in the index of a list the has the data about the methods.

Parameters:lineNum (int) – the number line of the program
Returns:the index in the list self.list_num_* that has the data about the methods in the java program.

modules.get_data_claims.GetDataClaims module¶

class modules.get_data_claims.GetDataClaims.GetDataClaims[source]¶

Bases: object

This program aims to gather the data in output from ESC/JAVA.

getClaim(lineClaim)[source]¶

Apply regex to get the assertion/property of line in the output text of the ESC/JAVA. Fisrt of all, we check if the claim has inside in a loop statement, in negative case we get the assertion/property.

Parameters:lineClaim (str) – the text line from the ESC/JAVA output with the assertion/property
Returns:only the assertion/property
getCommentInClaim(lineClaim)[source]¶

Apply regex to get the comments about the ESC/JAVA assertion/property

Parameters:lineClaim (str) – the text line from the ESC/JAVA output with the comment of the assertion/property
Returns:the comment about the assertion/property
getDataClaims()[source]¶

This method read the ESC/Java out saved in the list self.list_lines_file, then it is applied a set of REGEX to identify spefic pattern in the output to gather the assertions/properties point out by ESC/JAVA.

Returns:the list self.list_claims_translated that has list of list where each list is a line in csv format with the data of the assertions/properties from ESC/JAVA.
getNumLineInClaim(lineClaim)[source]¶

Apply regex to get the number of line in the assertion/property

Parameters:lineClaim (str) – the text line from the ESC/JAVA output with the line number of the assertion/property
Returns:the line number the assertion/property
getTagFromCommentCl(comment)[source]¶

Apply regex to get the TAG comments, i.e., an identifier the type of the ESC/JAVA assertion/property

Parameters:comment (str) – the text line from the ESC/JAVA output with the TAG of the assertion/property
Returns:the TAG comment of the assertion/property
prinFile()[source]¶

Adopted only to debug code modification.

Returns:void
readFile(pathFile)[source]¶

To read the java file and save the lines of the file in the list self.list_lines_file

Parameters:pathFile (str) – path of the java file
Returns:void
writeHeader2Csv()[source]¶

Write the header of the CSV file generated by this class

Returns:a text with the header defined to the CSV with the data from assertion/property.
